a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Global aviation demand, energy efficiency and CO₂ emissions, 1990 to

g.text: Passenger demand (billion passenger-km) Passenger demand (billion passenger-km)
Freight demand (million-ton km) Freight demand (million-ton km)
Energy intensity (per passenger-km) Energy intensity (per passenger-km)
CO₂ per unit energy (gCO₂eq per MJ) CO₂ per unit energy (gCO₂eq per MJ)
CO₂ intensity (gCO₂ per passenger-km) CO₂ intensity (gCO₂ per passenger-km)
CO₂ emissions (billion tonnes) CO₂ emissions (billion tonnes)

text.tspan: Data source: Bergero et al. (2023). Pathways to net-zero emissions from aviation.
Note: Carbon emissions are measured in carbon-dioxide equivalents, without adjustment for additional warming at altitude.
